title: Why I'm done with Mouser Electronics
dot: digraph{subgraph cluster_posts{label="Posts";"Lies, damned lies, and photodiodes"->"Diffusion and drift currents: depending on what you're trying to do, photodiodes can be really fast or infuriatingly slow.";"The marvelous disappearing capacitor"->"The performance of photodiode amplifiers can be improved in a clever way.";"Building a phosphorescence detector"->"There's very little written about natural phosphorescence. Let's design a device that can spot it in the wild.";"A 15 - minute intro to involute gears"->"Involute gears are everywhere: toys, kitchen appliances, cars. But what's so special about their shape?";"Deep dive: the instability of op - amps"->"A closer look at op - amp feedback loops and the stability criteria for circuits that use them.";"Shining light on photodiodes"->"Photodiodes are the most versatile light - sensing components. They are also commonly misunderstood.";"Memory: the forgotten history"->"Computers happened not because of Charles Babbage, but because of the invention of electronically - controlled intermediate data storage.";"Analog filters, part 2: let it ring"->"A continuation of the gentle intro to analog signal filtering. In today's episode: the Sallen - Key topology.";"How do wood finishes hold up?"->"A quick 18 - month experiment to shed light on traditional woodworking lore.";"A 15 - minute intro to hobby CNC"->"In which the author tilts at windmills for a brief while.";"The untimely demise of an image upscaler"->"ML - based image enhancement models are great. Unfortunately, some of them are great only once.";"The secret lives of snowblowers"->"Yes, they throw snow. But the mechanical design of residential snowblowers is more interesting than it seems.";}subgraph cluster_dates{label="Dates";"Dec 9"->"Lies, damned lies, and photodiodes";"Dec 7"->"The marvelous disappearing capacitor";"Nov 27"->"Building a phosphorescence detector";"Nov 17"->"A 15 - minute intro to involute gears";"Oct 26"->"Deep dive: the instability of op - amps";"Oct 21"->"Shining light on photodiodes";"Oct 15"->"Memory: the forgotten history";"Sep 30"->"Analog filters, part 2: let it ring";"Sep 7"->"How do wood finishes hold up?";"Sep 6"->"A 15 - minute intro to hobby CNC";"Aug 28"->"The untimely demise of an image upscaler";"Aug 17"->"The secret lives of snowblowers";}subgraph cluster_comments{label="Comments";"6"->"Lies, damned lies, and photodiodes";"3"->"The marvelous disappearing capacitor";"2"->"Building a phosphorescence detector";"5"->"A 15 - minute intro to involute gears";""->"Deep dive: the instability of op - amps";"3"->"Shining light on photodiodes";"4"->"Memory: the forgotten history";"5"->"Analog filters, part 2: let it ring";"13"->"How do wood finishes hold up?";"16"->"A 15 - minute intro to hobby CNC";"1"->"The untimely demise of an image upscaler";"3"->"The secret lives of snowblowers";}subgraph cluster_images{label="Images";"Image 50"->"Lies, damned lies, and photodiodes";"Image 51"->"The marvelous disappearing capacitor";"Image 52"->"Building a phosphorescence detector";"Image 53"->"A 15 - minute intro to involute gears";"Image 54"->"Deep dive: the instability of op - amps";"Image 55"->"Shining light on photodiodes";"Image 56"->"Memory: the forgotten history";"Image 57"->"Analog filters, part 2: let it ring";"Image 58"->"How do wood finishes hold up?";"Image 59"->"A 15 - minute intro to hobby CNC";"Image 60"->"The untimely demise of an image upscaler";"Image 61"->"The secret lives of snowblowers";}}
